name: zero
content:
zero

number
 
 
/ˈzɪərəʊ/
 
/ˈzɪrəʊ/
jump to other results
  1.  
    (plural zeros)
    (British English also nought)
    0
    • Five, four, three, two, one, zero… We have lift-off.
  2.  
     a temperature, pressure, etc. that is equal to zero on a scale
    • It was ten degrees below zero last night (= −10°C).
    • The thermometer had fallen to zero.
  3.  
     the lowest possible amount or level; nothing at all
    • I rated my chances as zero.
    • zero inflation
    4. Word Originearly 17th cent.: from French zéro or Italian zero, via Old Spanish from Arabic ṣifr ‘cipher’.
see also net-zero, patient zeroSee zero in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee zero in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English
Check pronunciation: zero

name: nought
content:
nought

noun
 
/nɔːt/
 
/nɔːt/
jump to other results
  1. [countable, uncountable] (British English)
    (also zero North American English, British English)
    the figure 0
    • A million is written with six noughts.
    • nought point one (= written 0.1)
    • I give the programme nought out of ten for humour.
    • This car can accelerate from nought to sixty in ten seconds.
    Topics Maths and measurementc1
  2. (also naught)
     [uncountable] (literary) used in particular phrases to mean ‘nothing’
    • All our efforts have come to nought (= have not been successful).
See nought in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: nought

name: net-zero
content:
net-zero

adjective
 
/ˌnet ˈzɪərəʊ/
 
/ˌnet ˈzɪrəʊ/
jump to other results
  1. in which the harmful gases produced by a particular company, region or country have no impact on the climate because they have been balanced by actions that protect the environment
    • The government announced a plan to achieve net-zero emissions by 2050.
    • the transition to a net-zero economy
    Topics The environmentc2
Check pronunciation: net-zero

content:
sub-zero

adjective
 
/ˌsʌb ˈzɪərəʊ/
 
/ˌsʌb ˈzɪrəʊ/
[usually before noun]
jump to other results
  1. (of temperatures) below zero compare subfreezing
See sub-zero in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: sub-zero

name: size zero
content:
size zero

noun
 
/ˌsaɪz ˈzɪərəʊ/
 
/ˌsaɪz ˈzɪrəʊ/
[uncountable, countable]
jump to other results
  1. (in the US) the smallest size for women’s clothes, used to describe women who are extremely thin
    • size zero models and celebrities
    • She is a size zero.
    • the fashion industry’s obsession with size zero
See size zero in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary

name: zero hour
content:
zero hour

noun
 
/ˈzɪərəʊ aʊə(r)/
 
/ˈzɪrəʊ aʊər/
[uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. the time when an important event, an attack, etc. is planned to start
    • It’s five minutes to zero hour.
See zero hour in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: zero hour

name: ground zero
content:
ground zero

noun
 
/ˌɡraʊnd ˈzɪərəʊ/
 
/ˌɡraʊnd ˈzɪrəʊ/
jump to other results
  1. [uncountable, countable] the point on the earth’s surface where a nuclear bomb explodes
  2. Ground Zero
     [uncountable] the site of the Twin Towers in New York, destroyed on 11 September 2001
    CultureThe Twin Towers were two very tall office buildings in Manhattan, New York City, built by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in 1972-3 and housing offices of the World Trade Centers Association. For a short time they were the tallest buildings in the world. Each was 1 368 feet/417 metres high and had 110 floors. A terrorist bomb exploded in the garage of the building in 1993 killing six people and injuring more than a thousand. On September 11th 2001 the Twin Towers were both destroyed in another terrorist attack. Two planes crashed into the towers, and a short time later both towers collapsed. The area where the building used to be became known as Ground Zero, and is now called the World Trade Center Site. It is the site of the National September 11 Memorial and Museum.see also September 11
  3. [uncountable] the beginning; a starting point for an activity
See ground zero in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: ground zero

name: zero-carbon
content:
zero-carbon

adjective
 
/ˌzɪərəʊ ˈkɑːbən/
 
/ˌzɪrəʊ ˈkɑːrbən/
jump to other results
  1. in which the amount of carbon dioxide produced has been reduced to nothing or is balanced by actions that protect the environment synonym carbon-neutral
    • a zero-carbon house that uses no energy from external sources
    Topics The environmentc1
See zero-carbon in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: zero-carbon

name: zero-hours
content:
zero-hours

adjective
 
/ˈzɪərəʊ aʊəz/
 
/ˈzɪrəʊ aʊərz/
(also zero-hour)
[only before noun] (British English)
jump to other results
  1. used to describe or refer to a contract of employment in which the employee is not guaranteed regular hours of work and is only paid for the hours they actually work
    • Workers on zero-hours contracts do not know how much they will earn from week to week.
    • The company is taking on more zero-hours workers.
    Topics Working lifec2
Check pronunciation: zero-hours

name: zero-rated
content:
zero-rated

adjective
 
/ˌzɪərəʊ ˈreɪtɪd/
 
/ˌzɪrəʊ ˈreɪtɪd/
(British English, specialist)
jump to other results
  1. (of goods, services, etc.) that you do not need to pay VAT (= value added tax) on
Check pronunciation: zero-rated

noun

name: patient zero
content:
patient zero

noun
 
/ˌpeɪʃnt ˈzɪərəʊ/
 
/ˌpeɪʃnt ˈzɪrəʊ/
 [singular] usually used without a (especially US English)
jump to other results
  1. the first person to be infected by a particular disease
    • The authorities have so far been unable to trace patient zero.
    Topics Health problemsc2

name: zero-emission
content:
zero-emission

adjective
 
/ˌzɪərəʊ ɪˈmɪʃn/
 
/ˌzɪrəʊ ɪˈmɪʃn/
 [only before noun]
jump to other results
  1. used to describe a vehicle that does not produce gases that cause pollution
    • Zero-emission cars—including all electric cars—are exempt from car tax.

name: zero in on
content:
zero in on

phrasal verb
jump to other results
zero in on somebody/something
  1. to fix all your attention on the person or thing mentioned
    • They zeroed in on the key issues.
  2. to aim guns, etc. at the person or thing mentioned
See zero in on in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
